Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Corinthian black-figured pottery kotyle; interior: glazed black (streaky in places); exterior: two bands (fired brown) above black-figure decoration consisting of confronted goat and panther (of grazing goat, shoulder, neck, head, and antler remaining; of panther, part of head, chest, shoulder, forelegs, and underbelly; added red on necks of both animals and shoulder and underbelly of panther); incised rosettes and blobs as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Bryn Mawr, the Art and Artifact Collections. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd joins Bryn Mawr P.804.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.230) (phase 3)
